citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
During inspection it was found that there was a buildup of hair in the corners of primary enclosures. There was organic
material built up on the outside of the doors of the primary enclosures where the dogs could reach with their paws. There
was organic build-up on some of the interior walls and the doors to the exterior portion of the enclosure.
A buildup of material in the enclosure increases the risk of disease, pests, insects, and orders that can adversely effect
the health of the dogs.
Primary enclosures must be sanitized at least once every two weeks using a method approved in Part 3 section 3.11
(b)(3) to prevent the accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards.
Correction Date: January 15, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
During inspection it was found that there was a buildup of hair in the corners of primary enclosures. There was organic 
material built up on the outside of the doors of the primary enclosures where the dogs could reach with their paws. There 
was organic build-up on some of the interior walls and the doors to the exterior portion of the enclosure.  
A buildup of material in the enclosure increases the risk of disease, pests, insects, and orders that can adversely effect 
the health of the dogs. 
Primary enclosures must be sanitized at least once every two weeks using a method approved in Part 3 section 3.11 
(b)(3) to prevent the accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards. 
Correction Date: January 15, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
